intro: Horkelia wilderae, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky habitats and alpine meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its blooming period occurs in the spring, and it produces small, white or pale blue flowers. Horkelia wilderae is known for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators in its native range.
